head.title: Coronavirus/COVID-19 - Health Services - Moses Lake School District 161

meta.name: description
meta.content: Moses Lake School District is a dynamic district that covers over 400 square miles in Grant County and serves 8,700+ students. We proudly educate in 16 schools, comprised of one high school, one technical skill center, three middle schools, and ten elementary schools– with a second high school slated for completion in 2022. We employ 1100+ professionals dedicated to the development and well-being of our learning community.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Moses Lake, School District, Education, Washington State

div.p: The main office for MLSD is now at the Learning Services Center, located at 1620 South Pioneer Way, Moses Lake, WA 98837. Phone: 509-766-2650 Fax: 509-766-2678

div.p: Certificated and Classified info, staff absence management, required training, professional development and email access.

li.a: The info you need. In one place. (Main page)
Soporte Tecnológico para Aprendizaje a Distancia

div.p: Find supply lists, registration info, school contact info, building addresses and more within Resource Central. Here is where you will find information that is common across all/many of the schools.

span.style: font-size: 18pt

div.div: April 6, Governor Inslee and Superintendent Reykdal have confirmed school facilities will remain closed for on-site instruction for the entirety of the school year.

div.br: Superintendent Dr. Joshua Meek affirms, "As our state continues our efforts at 'flattening the curve' by staying home and staying healthy, the Governor's decision is as expected, and we are starting to see some impacts of these aggressive moves. Unfortunately, this mandate also means our inability to return to our school buildings this school year."
We understand you have many questions– What does this mean for my child's education? How are we moving forward? What will graduation look like?

"The good news is that our dedicated team of staff has already been working hard to provide essential services and remote delivery," says Meek. "We already have the systems and ability to maintain connections with our learning community, and will continue to provide:

div.div: We will continue to do our very best to meet our student's needs– this mandate just extends our efforts."

div.br: We anticipate more details and instruction from the state and will continue to provide more information as it becomes available.

span.style: color: #3c4043; font-size: small; font-family: roboto, helveticaneue, arial, sans-serif

div.span: Hoy, 6 de abril a las 2:30 pm, el gobernador Inslee y el superintendente Reykdal han confirmado que las instalaciones escolares permanecerán cerradas para la instrucción en el lugar durante todo el año escolar. El superintendente Dr. Joshua Meek afirma: "A medida que nuestro estado continúa nuestros esfuerzos para 'aplanar la curva' al permanecer en casa y mantenerse saludable, la decisión del Gobernador es la esperada, y estamos comenzando a ver algunos impactos de estos movimientos agresivos. Desafortunadamente, esto mandato también significa nuestra incapacidad para regresar a nuestros edificios escolares este año escolar ". Entendemos que tiene muchas preguntas: ¿qué significa esto para la educación de mi hijo? ¿Cómo estamos avanzando? ¿Cómo será la graduación? "La buena noticia es que nuestro equipo dedicado de personal ya ha estado trabajando duro para proporcionar servicios esenciales y entrega remota", dice Meek. "Ya tenemos los sistemas y la capacidad de mantener conexiones con nuestra comunidad de aprendizaje, y continuaremos brindando: • Entrega remota de instrucciones • Servicios de alimentación y cuidado infantil. Continuaremos haciendo todo lo posible para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros estudiantes: este mandato solo extiende nuestros esfuerzos ". Anticipamos más detalles e instrucciones del estado y continuaremos brindando más información a medida que esté disponible.

p.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

div.p: School is happening as planned for Monday, March 16, 2020

p.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

div.p: Governor Inslee's recent announcement for the closure of restaurants, entertainment facilities, and groups over 50 is generating a few questions about school tomorrow. The Governor's order will not be signed until tomorrow, and his office has clarified that schools can meet tomorrow as planned. The school closure does not begin until Tuesday, March 17.

p.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; padding: 0px; margin: 0px

div.p: As a district, we take decisions like this very seriously and weigh out all of the options carefully.
Parents who feel like it is in their child's best interest to not attend are welcome to make that personal choice and be supported by the school district.
We will release a set of make-up times for the distribution of a Chromebook to students not in attendance on Monday, March 16.

span.span: We encourage all students to attend school Monday, March 16th.

br.span: • Please bring your Chromebooks and chargers to all classes on Monday, March 16th to so that we can ensure they are functioning properly.

br.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

br.span: We are aware that not everyone has internet capabilities in their homes. We are working diligently to ensure all students will have access, more details and information will be provided soon.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Following the executive order issued by Washington state Governor Jay Inslee today, the Moses Lake School District will close all school facilities, beginning March 17th. The closures will remain in effect through April 24th.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Monday, March 16 is the last day of school, including athletics, activities, and clubs.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Georgia; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We are working with the Governor, OSPI, Superintendents across the state, public health advisors from across the state along with our local community leaders and administration to do what is best for our students, staff, families and community members. At this time, reducing the spread of COVID-19 is the best strategy for all.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: While we expect to receive more details and further guidance from state officials regarding this decision in the coming days, here is what we do know:

li.span: All schools in our state will now be closed through April 24, 2020

li.span: All athletics, extracurricular, and building/facility use is suspended

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

li.span: All school buildings will be closed. No students or community members should enter the building during the closure

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

li.span: Parents should plan to pick up any medication their child requires during the closure

li.span: We will implement remote delivery instruction, as soon as we ensure all students are fully equipped with the technology and internet sources necessary.

li.span: Grades 5-12 are equipped with 1:1 technology already and students will continue to use their device

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

li.span: Grades K-4 will receive technology tools on Monday for use at home including a student Chromebook and charger

color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

li.span: Preschool services will be available via a Google Classroom for parents to do at home learning activities with their child

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Special Education services will be delivered remotely

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Food Services plans are in progress to have a neighborhood meal program for lunch and breakfast for our community’s youth

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: We will be rescheduling as many events as possible, including Kindergarten registration

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We understand that extended school closure will create hardship among numerous families in our district, and our community relies on numerous resources and services our schools provide. Weeks without conventional structure and care may seem overwhelming– both emotionally and financially. Please know that we are doing our very best to make decisions that will help care for all of us through this time.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This closure requires a tremendous amount of hard work, dedication, and creativity from all of our staff, and we are grateful for your patience and understanding as we continue to work through this difficult situation. We will be sending frequent updates with information and resources via email, text messages, the website, and social media channels.

br.span: Today at approximately 1:30 pm Governor Jay Inslee declared the closure of schools to be statewide.

br.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: left
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: left

span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: left

br.span: Our first day of closure will begin on Tuesday, March 17 through April 24th. Monday, March 16 will be a "normal" school day.

br.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: left
font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: left

span.style: font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif; text-align: left

br.span: We understand you have many questions, and we will continue to provide frequent updates as the situation evolves. We appreciate your continued patience as we navigate the closure.

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

br.span: 03.12.20 – Governor Inslee's recent announcement for school closure in King, Pierce, and Snohomish counties has prompted many questions. At this time the Moses Lake School District will continue our school operations until we receive additional information and guidance from the Grant County Health District or state officials.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The health, safety, and well-being of our students and our community are of paramount importance to the Moses Lake School District. It is important to reiterate, there are

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: of COVID-19 in Moses Lake OR the Moses Lake School District at this time. However, due to the spread of the COVID-19 virus to our region, the Grant County Health District has advised schools and other organizations to practice social distancing and to consider postponing public events, gatherings, and functions.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In response to the updated guidance, the Moses Lake School District has made the decision

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: sports, events, concerts, and meetings involving the public. The cancellation includes community-use of all school district facilities. The mandate begins Friday, March 13th and adjourns Sunday, April 12th, unless otherwise notified.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: and athletics

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: be affected by cancellations at this time.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: External groups and clubs will be contacted directly

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: by our Community Schools Office to reschedule or postpone their event. Additionally, out-of-district travel will be significantly reduced to eliminate the risk of exposure for our students and staff. We will continue to evaluate the situation as it evolves and as more information becomes available.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We recognize the inconvenience and impact that this decision has on the community; however, this action 1) will contribute significantly to the region-wide effort to mitigate social contact and minimize the spread of the illness, 2) aims to reduce potential exposure of our school communities to visitors that may have been exposed to COVID-19, 3) allows us to conserve our resources (cleaning supplies, necessary staff, etc.) to ensure educational operations remain normal for as long as possible.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Information on COVID-19 changes daily, however,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We work directly with state, regional, and local epidemiologists, doctors, and other public health officials to make the most informed decision for our students, staff, families, and community members. Currently, the Department of Health is

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: that schools proactively close–w

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: e need to do our best to remain open for students to continue learning.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The COVID-19 virus, transmitted by direct contact, has the greatest impact on adults over the age of 60 and those with compromised immune systems. People at higher risk and those exhibiting symptoms consistent with COVID-19 should

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: avoid close contact with others, and avoid large groups of people as much as possible.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We are taking steps to ensure that our school facilities are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized regularly. We have also taken proactive measures to minimize the spreading of germs through our student meal program and continue to encourage students and staff to regularly wash their hands with soap and water throughout the day.

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

font-size: 12pt; font-family: Cambria,serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We appreciate your patience as we navigate the daily challenges presented by COVID-19. The Moses Lake School District plays a vital role in limiting the spread of this virus, and we feel this precaution is necessary to reduce possible exposure given the information and recommendations at this time.

p.strong: The following practices are extremely important for all students and adults:

ul.li: If staff or students are experiencing cold or flu-like symptoms (fever, cough, shortness of breath) Stay home. Please contact your doctor or school nurse with any questions. If you’re experiencing symptoms, call your primary care physician or urgent care clinic.
Wash hands often with soap and water. If you do not have soap and water, use alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.

Sneeze and cough into a tissue, elbow or sleeve instead of your hands. Throw used tissues in a garbage container immediately after use. If you use your hands to cover a sneeze or cough, wash your hands immediately with soap and water or alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Avoid rubbing your eyes, touching your nose or putting your fingers by or in your mouth.
Avoid close contact with anyone with cold or flu-like symptoms.

div.div: The Washington State Department of Health has established a call center to address questions from the public. Call 1-800-525-0127 and press #.
Washington State Department of Health (DOH) and Centers for Disease Control (CDC) share information about COVID-19 at:

div.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: font-family: inherit
font-family: inherit

div.style: color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

div.span: We are committed to keeping our community informed and the safety of our community is our first priority. Thus, in partnership with the Grant County Health District, a community event that was to be held at Chief Moses Middle School has been canceled due to potential risk of exposure to COVID-19.

br.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

br.span: The event, which had already been set up by participants, has now been disassembled and disinfected. The recommendation for cancellation comes as a precaution for our district, especially with participants traveling from outside of our community.

br.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

br.span: We continue to urge our students, parents, and staff members to practice preventative practices, including proper hygiene and staying home when sick.

br.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif
color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

span.style: color: #1d2129; font-size: 14px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, system-ui, '.SFNSText-Regular', sans-serif

div.p: "The general American public is unlikely to be exposed to the virus that causes COVID-19 at this time, so the immediate health risk from COVID-19 is considered low. The risk of exposure is increasing for people who live in communities in Washington state with reported spread of COVID-19, though risk is still relatively low. Fact sheets (11 languages) and more information are available at the Washington State Department of Health."
At this time we have no confirmed cases in our schools. Our district takes this health risk very seriously and we will continue to inform our community as we monitor the situation.

Moses Lake School District will continue to monitor and follow the guidance provided by the Washington State Department of Public Health and Center for Disease Control (CDC) regarding the Coronavirus.

The safety and well-being of our community is our top concern and we're committed to keeping you informed. That's why our Health Services Department is partnering with the Washington State Department of Health, Grant County Health District, and OSPI to bring you and your family peace of mind.

Novel coronavirus (COVID-19) is a new virus strain spreading from person-to-person in China and other countries, including the United States. In most instances, cases outside of China have been associated with travelers from China. Health experts are concerned because little is known about this new virus and it has the potential to cause severe illness and pneumonia in some people.
Health experts are still learning the details. Currently, it is thought to spread:

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: via respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes.

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet).

div.p: Experts are still learning about the range of illness from novel coronavirus. Reported cases have ranged from mild illness (similar to a common cold) to severe pneumonia that requires hospitalization. So far, deaths have been reported mainly in older adults who had other health conditions.
People who have been diagnosed with novel coronavirus have reported symptoms that may appear in as few as 2 days or as long as 14 days after exposure to the virus.
Symptoms include: fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.
div.h3: Who is at risk for novel coronavirus?
div.p: Currently the risk to the general public is low. At this time, there are a small number of individual cases in the U.S. To minimize the risk of spread, health officials are working with healthcare providers to promptly identify and evaluate any suspected cases.

Travelers to and from certain areas of the world may be at increased risk. Although coronavirus originated geographically in Wuhan, China, the disease is not specific to any ethnic group. Chinese ancestry – or any other ancestry – does not make a person more vulnerable to this illness.
div.h3: How can I prevent from getting novel coronavirus?
div.p: If you are traveling overseas (to China but also to other places) follow the CDC’s guidance: wwwnc.cdc.govtravel.

Right now, the novel coronavirus has not been spreading widely in the United States, so there are no additional precautions recommended for the general public. Steps you can take to prevent spread of flu and the common cold will also help prevent coronavirus:

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: Wash hands often with soap and water. If not available, use hand sanitizer.

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: Avoid contact with people who are sick.

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: Stay home while you are sick and avoid close contact with others.

li.style: font-size: inherit; font-family: inherit

ul.li: Cover your mouth/nose with a tissue or sleeve when coughing or sneezing.

div.p: Currently, there are no vaccines available to prevent novel coronavirus infections.

There are no medications specifically approved for coronavirus. Most people with mild coronavirus illness will recover on their own by drinking plenty of fluids, resting, and taking pain and fever medications. However, some cases develop pneumonia and require medical care or hospitalization.
